mdRecord.dcterms:description: Hopewell Furnace National Historic Site in southeastern Berks County, near Elverson, Pennsylvania, is an example of an American 19th century rural "iron plantation". Early ironworks used water power to operate the huge bellows which blew air into the furnace. For this reason Hopewell is called a “blast furnace” because blasts of air were pumped into the fire to speed up the smelting process. Hopewell Furnace was founded in 1771 by ironmaster Mark Bird. http://www.nps.gov/hofu/forteachers/upload/sgtour.pdf [work]
